name: NIST Cybersecurity Framework 2.0
description: The NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) 2.0 provides guidance to industry, government agencies, and other organizations to manage cybersecurity risks. It offers a taxonomy of high-level cybersecurity outcomes that can be used by any organization.
source: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)

requirements.title: GOVERN
requirements.description: The organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy are established, communicated, and monitored.

children.title: Organizational Context
children.description: The circumstances — mission, stakeholder expectations, dependencies, and legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements — surrounding the organization's cybersecurity risk management decisions are understood.

children.title: Mission Understanding
children.description: The organizational mission is understood and informs cybersecurity risk management.

children.title: Internal Stakeholders
children.description: Internal stakeholders understand and can articulate how the organization's mission relates to their role.

children.title: Legal Requirements
children.description: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements regarding cybersecurity — including privacy and civil liberties obligations — are understood and managed.

children.title: Critical Objectives
children.description: Critical objectives, capabilities, and services that external stakeholders depend on or expect from the organization are understood and communicated.

children.title: Dependencies and Resilience
children.description: Outcomes, capabilities, and services that the organization depends on are understood and actions are taken to manage risk from external dependencies.

children.title: Risk Management Strategy
children.description: The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerance and appetite statements, and assumptions are established, communicated, and used to support operational risk decisions.

children.title: Risk Management Objectives
children.description: Risk management objectives are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.

children.title: Risk Appetite Statements
children.description: Risk appetite and risk tolerance statements are established, communicated, and maintained.

children.title: Risk Management Integration
children.description: Cybersecurity risk management activities and outcomes are included in enterprise risk management processes.

children.title: Strategic Direction
children.description: Strategic direction that describes appropriate risk response options is established and communicated.

children.title: Supply Chain Risk
children.description: Lines of communication across the organization are established for cybersecurity risks, including risks from suppliers and other third parties.

children.title: Standardized Methods
children.description: A standardized method for calculating, documenting, categorizing, and prioritizing cybersecurity risks is established and communicated.

children.title: Opportunities
children.description: Strategic opportunities (positive risks) are characterized and communicated.

children.title: Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities
children.description: Cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and authorities to foster accountability, performance assessment, and continuous improvement are established and communicated.

children.title: Leadership Accountability
children.description: Organizational leadership is responsible and accountable for cybersecurity risk and fosters a culture that is risk-aware, ethical, and continually improving.

children.title: Roles Established
children.description: Roles, responsibilities, and authorities related to cybersecurity risk management are established, communicated, understood, and enforced.

children.title: Adequate Resources
children.description: Adequate resources are allocated commensurate with the cybersecurity risk strategy, roles, responsibilities, and policies.

children.title: Cybersecurity in HR
children.description: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices.

children.title: Policy
children.description: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established, communicated, and enforced.

children.title: Policy Established
children.description: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is established based on organizational context, cybersecurity strategy, and priorities and is communicated and enforced.

children.title: Policy Review
children.description: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is reviewed, updated, communicated, and enforced to reflect changes in requirements, threats, technology, and organizational mission.

children.title: Oversight
children.description: Results of organization-wide cybersecurity risk management activities and performance are used to inform, improve, and adjust the risk management strategy.

children.title: Status Reviews
children.description: Cybersecurity risk management strategy outcomes are reviewed to inform and adjust strategy and direction.

children.title: Strategy Adjustment
children.description: The cybersecurity risk management strategy is reviewed and adjusted to ensure coverage of organizational requirements and risks.

children.title: Performance Evaluation
children.description: Organizational cybersecurity risk management performance is evaluated and reviewed for adjustments needed.

children.title: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management
children.description: Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, managed, monitored, and improved by organizational stakeholders.

children.title: SCRM Program
children.description: A cybersecurity supply chain risk management program, strategy, objectives, policies, and processes are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.

children.title: Roles for SCRM
children.description: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for suppliers, customers, and partners are established, communicated, and coordinated internally and externally.

children.title: SCRM Integration
children.description: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management is integrated into cybersecurity and enterprise risk management, risk assessment, and improvement processes.

children.title: Supplier Assessment
children.description: Suppliers are known and prioritized by criticality.

children.title: Requirements in Contracts
children.description: Requirements to address cybersecurity risks in supply chains are established, prioritized, and integrated into contracts and other agreements with suppliers and other relevant third parties.

children.title: Due Diligence
children.description: Planning and due diligence are performed to reduce risks before entering into formal supplier or other third-party relationships.

children.title: Supplier Risk Assessment
children.description: The risks posed by a supplier, their products and services, and other third parties are identified, recorded, prioritized, assessed, responded to, and monitored over the course of the relationship.

children.title: Supplier Monitoring
children.description: Relevant suppliers and other third parties are included in incident planning, response, and recovery activities.

children.title: SCRM Practices
children.description: Supply chain security practices are integrated into cybersecurity and enterprise risk management programs, and their performance is monitored throughout the technology product and service life cycle.

children.title: Post-Relationship
children.description: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management plans include provisions for activities that occur after the conclusion of a partnership or service agreement.

requirements.title: IDENTIFY
requirements.description: The organization's current cybersecurity risks are understood.

children.title: Asset Management
children.description: Assets that enable the organization to achieve business purposes are identified and managed consistent with their relative importance to organizational objectives and the organization's risk strategy.

children.title: Hardware Inventory
children.description: Inventories of hardware managed by the organization are maintained.

children.title: Software Inventory
children.description: Inventories of software, services, and systems managed by the organization are maintained.

children.title: Network Representation
children.description: Representations of the organization's authorized network communication and internal and external network data flows are maintained.

children.title: External Services
children.description: Inventories of services provided by suppliers are maintained.

children.title: Asset Prioritization
children.description: Assets are prioritized based on classification, criticality, resources, and impact on the mission.

children.title: Data Inventory
children.description: Inventories of data and corresponding metadata for designated data types are maintained.

children.title: End of Life
children.description: Systems, hardware, software, and services are managed through removal, transfers, and disposition.

children.title: Risk Assessment
children.description: The cybersecurity risk to the organization, assets, and individuals is identified, understood, and used to support risk treatment decisions.

children.title: Vulnerability Identification
children.description: Vulnerabilities in assets are identified, validated, and recorded.

children.title: Threat Intelligence
children.description: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources.

children.title: Threat Identification
children.description: Internal and external threats to the organization are identified and recorded.

children.title: Impact Analysis
children.description: Potential impacts and likelihoods of threats exploiting vulnerabilities are identified and recorded.

children.title: Risk Prioritization
children.description: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to understand inherent risk and inform risk response prioritization.

children.title: Risk Responses
children.description: Risk responses are chosen, prioritized, planned, tracked, and communicated.

children.title: Risk Changes
children.description: Changes and exceptions are managed, assessed for risk impact, recorded, and tracked.

children.title: Residual Risk
children.description: Processes for receiving, tracking, and responding to vulnerability disclosures are established.

children.title: Severity Assessment
children.description: The authenticity and integrity of hardware and software are assessed prior to acquisition and use.

children.title: Critical Supplier Assessment
children.description: Critical suppliers are assessed prior to acquisition.

children.title: Improvement
children.description: Improvements to organizational cybersecurity risk management processes, procedures, and activities are identified across all CSF Functions.

children.title: Lessons Learned
children.description: Improvements are identified from evaluations.

children.title: Security Tests
children.description: Improvements are identified from security tests and exercises, including those done in coordination with suppliers and relevant third parties.

children.title: Operational Improvements
children.description: Improvements are identified from execution of operational processes, procedures, and activities.

children.title: Incident Improvements
children.description: Improvements are identified from incident response and recovery activities.

requirements.title: PROTECT
requirements.description: Safeguards to manage the organization's cybersecurity risks are used.

children.title: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control
children.description: Access to physical and logical assets is limited to authorized users, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access.

children.title: Identity Management
children.description: Identities and credentials for authorized users, services, and hardware are managed by the organization.

children.title: Identity Proofing
children.description: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials based on the context of interactions.

children.title: Authentication
children.description: Users, services, and hardware are authenticated.

children.title: Access Assertions
children.description: Identity assertions are protected, conveyed, and verified.

children.title: Access Permissions
children.description: Access permissions, entitlements, and authorizations are defined in a policy, managed, enforced, and reviewed, and incorporate the principles of least privilege and separation of duties.

children.title: Physical Access
children.description: Physical access to assets is managed, monitored, and enforced commensurate with risk.

children.title: Awareness and Training
children.description: The organization's personnel are provided with cybersecurity awareness and training so that they can perform their cybersecurity-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements.

children.title: Awareness Training
children.description: Personnel are provided with awareness and training so that they possess the knowledge and skills to perform general tasks with cybersecurity risks in mind.

children.title: Specialized Training
children.description: Individuals in specialized roles are provided with awareness and training so that they possess the knowledge and skills to perform relevant tasks with cybersecurity risks in mind.

children.title: Data Security
children.description: Data are managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information.

children.title: Data at Rest
children.description: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-at-rest are protected.

children.title: Data in Transit
children.description: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-transit are protected.

children.title: Data in Use
children.description: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-use are protected.

children.title: Backups
children.description: Backups of data are created, protected, maintained, and tested.

children.title: Platform Security
children.description: The hardware, software, and services of physical and virtual platforms are managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect their confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

children.title: Configuration Management
children.description: Configuration management practices are established and applied.

children.title: Software Maintenance
children.description: Software is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk.

children.title: Hardware Maintenance
children.description: Hardware is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk.

children.title: Log Generation
children.description: Log records are generated and made available for continuous monitoring.

children.title: Unauthorized Installation
children.description: Installation and execution of unauthorized software are prevented.

children.title: Secure Development
children.description: Secure software development practices are integrated, and their performance is monitored throughout the software development life cycle.

children.title: Technology Infrastructure Resilience
children.description: Security architectures are managed with the organization's risk strategy to protect asset confidentiality, integrity, and availability, and organizational resilience.

children.title: Network Protection
children.description: Networks and environments are protected from unauthorized logical access and usage.

children.title: Resilience for Assets
children.description: The organization's technology assets are protected from environmental threats.

children.title: Resilience Mechanisms
children.description: Mechanisms are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations.

children.title: Recovery Capacity
children.description: Adequate resource capacity to ensure availability is maintained.

requirements.title: DETECT
requirements.description: Possible cybersecurity attacks and compromises are found and analyzed.

children.title: Continuous Monitoring
children.description: Assets are monitored to find anomalies, indicators of compromise, and other potentially adverse events.

children.title: Network Monitoring
children.description: Networks and network services are monitored to find potentially adverse events.

children.title: Environment Monitoring
children.description: The physical environment is monitored to find potentially adverse events.

children.title: Personnel Monitoring
children.description: Personnel activity and technology usage are monitored to find potentially adverse events.

children.title: External Service Monitoring
children.description: External service provider activities and services are monitored to find potentially adverse events.

children.title: Computing Monitoring
children.description: Computing hardware and software, runtime environments, and their data are monitored to find potentially adverse events.

children.title: Adverse Event Analysis
children.description: Anomalies, indicators of compromise, and other potentially adverse events are analyzed to characterize the events and detect cybersecurity incidents.

children.title: Event Correlation
children.description: Potentially adverse events are analyzed to better understand associated activities.

children.title: Information Correlation
children.description: Information is correlated from multiple sources.

children.title: Impact Estimation
children.description: The estimated impact and scope of adverse events are understood.

children.title: Incident Declaration
children.description: Information on adverse events is provided to authorized staff and tools.

children.title: Threat Intelligence Integration
children.description: Cyber threat intelligence and other contextual information are integrated into the analysis.

children.title: Incident Declaration
children.description: Incidents are declared when adverse events meet the defined incident criteria.

requirements.title: RESPOND
requirements.description: Actions regarding a detected cybersecurity incident are taken.

children.title: Incident Management
children.description: Responses to detected cybersecurity incidents are managed.

children.title: Incident Response Plan
children.description: The incident response plan is executed in coordination with relevant third parties once an incident is declared.

children.title: Incident Triage
children.description: Incidents are categorized and prioritized.

children.title: Incident Investigation
children.description: Incidents are investigated.

children.title: Incident Escalation
children.description: Incidents are escalated or elevated as needed.

children.title: Incident Criteria
children.description: The criteria for initiating incident recovery are applied.

children.title: Incident Analysis
children.description: Investigations are conducted to ensure effective response and support forensics and recovery activities.

children.title: Root Cause Analysis
children.description: Analysis is performed to establish what has taken place during an incident and the root cause of the incident.

children.title: Integrity Verification
children.description: Actions performed during an investigation are recorded, and the records' integrity and provenance are preserved.

children.title: Forensics Collection
children.description: Incident data and metadata are collected, and their integrity and provenance are preserved.

children.title: Forensics Handling
children.description: An incident's magnitude is estimated and validated.

children.title: Incident Response Reporting and Communication
children.description: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders as required by laws, regulations, or policies.

children.title: Internal Stakeholders
children.description: Internal stakeholders are notified of incidents.

children.title: External Stakeholders
children.description: External stakeholders are notified of incidents.

children.title: Information Sharing
children.description: Information is shared with designated internal and external stakeholders.

children.title: Incident Mitigation
children.description: Activities are performed to prevent expansion of an event and mitigate its effects.

children.title: Incident Containment
children.description: Incidents are contained.

children.title: Incident Eradication
children.description: Incidents are eradicated.

requirements.title: RECOVER
requirements.description: Assets and operations affected by a cybersecurity incident are restored.

children.title: Incident Recovery Plan Execution
children.description: Restoration activities are performed to ensure operational availability of systems and services affected by cybersecurity incidents.

children.title: Recovery Plan
children.description: The recovery portion of the incident response plan is executed once initiated from the incident response process.

children.title: Recovery Selection
children.description: Recovery actions are selected, scoped, prioritized, and performed.

children.title: Backup Verification
children.description: The integrity of backups and other restoration assets is verified before using them for restoration.

children.title: Mission Functions
children.description: Critical mission functions and cybersecurity risk management are considered to establish post-incident operational norms.

children.title: Recovery Verification
children.description: The integrity of restored assets is verified, systems and services are restored, and normal operating status is confirmed.

children.title: Recovery Completion
children.description: The end of incident recovery is declared based on criteria, and incident-related documentation is completed.

children.title: Incident Recovery Communication
children.description: Restoration activities are coordinated with internal and external parties.

children.title: Recovery Updates
children.description: Recovery activities and progress in restoring operational capabilities are communicated to designated internal and external stakeholders.

children.title: Public Communications
children.description: Public updates on incident recovery are shared using approved methods and messaging.
